16:56 <msmeria> has quit  
16:57 <floflobel> Hi, I need to include a page in Dashboard, I use the gadget "Display" and I don't know how to find the "Reference" of the page, anyone have an idea ?  
17:00 <Enygma`> Hi floflobel. A simple way to determine the reference is to look at the address (URL) of the page you want to include/display and take the part to the right of "/bin/view/" (.e.g "Main/WebHome") and replace "/" with ".". Also note that if the address ends with a "/", you have to replace that with ".WebHome", e.g. "/bin/view/Main/" -> "Main.WebHome"  
17:01 <Enygma`> while "/bin/view/Main/SomethingElse" translates to "Main.SomethingElse" (no "/" at the end of the address, so no need for ".WebHome" at the end)  
17:02 <Enygma`> it`s a bit non-intuitive for the moment and we are considering adding some easy ways in the UI to get the reference, but until then, you should be able to manage with the above process  
17:04 <Enygma`> additionally, if you want to reference a page that is located on another subwiki (or from a subwiki to the main wiki), you have to prefix the reference with the wiki name, e.g. "xwiki:Main.WebHome" (main wiki's homepage) vs "someWiki:Main.WebHome" (homepage of "someWiki").  
17:05 <floflobel> Enygma`, thank's for your reply it's work perfectly.  
17:05 <Enygma`> ;)  
17:09 <vmassol> floflobel: there's also a FAQ entry about this: https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+get+the+reference+of+a+page  
17:10 <vmassol> @Eny  
17:11 <vmassol> Enygma: you may want to update that page with the info you created above ;)  
17:11 <vmassol> I think your answer details the second bullet point of that FAQ entry  
17:11 <vmassol> well  
17:11 <vmassol> I'm not sure since detailing will mean maintenance work when the format changes  
17:12 <vmassol> maybe the link to the standartd url format is good enough actually  
17:12 <Denis> has quit

18:13 <floflobel> vmassol, yes the title is empty, thank's :)
